snippet: The European Commission president, José Manuel Barroso, offered strikingly robust criticism of efforts in France to limit the scope of a trade pact with the United States.
abstract: Jose Manuel Barrosso, European Commission president, says Europe must shun reactionary opposition to globalization; criticizes efforts in France to limit scope of trade pact with United States; discussion of proposed trans-Atlantic trade accord is expected at upcoming Group of 8 meeting.

byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and STEPHEN CASTLE

lead_paragraph: The European Commission president, José Manuel Barroso, offered strikingly robust criticism of efforts in France to limit the scope of a trade pact with the United States.

headline.main: European Official Takes On the French
headline.print_headline: European Commission President Criticizes Opposition to Globalization
